name: ReputationEscrow
description: A Reputation Escrow. This contract extends AccessControl: -To restrict functionality access for only specific roles. This contract can be used : - To store tokens as an asset, - To transfer the stored asset to another account given that the caller has a specified role to transfer -To withdraw asset based on the permissions of the account with Escrow role.

functionDecorators.name: balanceOf
functionDecorators.description: Returns the amount of assets for a given account in the contract.

parameterDecorators.name: account
parameterDecorators.description: address of the owner of the asset.

functionDecorators.name: batchBurn
functionDecorators.description: Burns token of accounts that have been punished by the reputations system.

parameterDecorators.name: receivers
parameterDecorators.description: accounts that will be punished amount of XREP assets to.

parameterDecorators.name: amounts
parameterDecorators.description: amount of XREP assets to punish a corresponding account.

functionDecorators.name: batchTransfer
functionDecorators.description: Moves `value` assets from the caller's account to `reciever`.

parameterDecorators.name: receivers
parameterDecorators.description: arrays of accounts that each will receive the transferd asset.

parameterDecorators.name: amounts
parameterDecorators.description: arrays of assets to be tranfered to each corresponding account.

returnDecorators.description: a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

functionDecorators.name: deposit
functionDecorators.description: Deposits `value` assets for the caller's account given that the caller has allowed value allowance of token to the contract. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Deposit} event.

functionDecorators.name: disableWithdraw
functionDecorators.description: Sets withdraw state to disabled and can only be called by an account with a Escrow Role. Emits a {WithDrawState} event.

functionDecorators.name: enableWithdraw
functionDecorators.description: Sets withdraw stateEmits a {WithDrawState} event. to disabled and can only be called by an account with a Escrow Role. Emits a {WithDrawState} event.

functionDecorators.name: getRoleAdmin
functionDecorators.description: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

functionDecorators.name: grantRole
functionDecorators.description: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

functionDecorators.name: isWithdrawEnabled
functionDecorators.description: Returns a boolean value indicating the state of withdrawal functionality.

functionDecorators.name: renounceRole
functionDecorators.description: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRole
functionDecorators.description: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

functionDecorators.name: withdraw
functionDecorators.description: Withdraws `value` assets from the caller's account to `reciever`.

returnDecorators.description: a boolean value indicating the success of the transfer transaction. Emits a {Withdraw} event.
